represented in figure 1. These are the 
fibres I have just described wh: coursing[?] from 
the under surface of the frontal lobe of the op-
posite side have crossed in the corpus callosum 
and are now arching backwards to join the 
<u>tractus medius <\u> & <u>externus <\u>. Further, what is
described by Meynert as the anterior peduncle 
of the thalamus (vorderer Stiel) is simply a large 
leash of these fibres. It is not derived, as 
Meynert supposes, from the frontal lobe of 
the same side, but is simply part of the fibres 
wh: have crossed in the corpus callosum 
and have turned round in the <u>crossed callosal 
tract<\u>, ultimately, to reach the thalamus 
opticus. Finally it may be said that the 
whole of the fibres from the anterior extremity 
of the frontal lobe cross in the corpus callosum;
they are mixed up with those from the opposite 
side while within the corpus callosum, but 
when they have crossed they separate from 
the latter turn backwards & (ultimately) <s>form in part <\s>
enter the inner & outer capsules. <s>By the <\s> They do 
not, however, enter the inner & outer capsules 
directly, but are distributed first to the <u>tractus<\u>
